meanings.definition: To strike or hit with great force.
meanings.sent1: He whaled the ball with all his might.
meanings.sent2: The boxer whaled his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent3: The little boy whaled the pinata until it burst open.
meanings.sent4: The storm whaled against the windows, shaking the whole house.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith whaled the red-hot metal to shape it perfectly.

meanings.definition: To defeat thoroughly in a competition or argument.
meanings.sent1: She whaled her opponent in the chess match.
meanings.sent2: The team whaled their rivals in the final game.
meanings.sent3: The lawyer whaled the opposing counsel with solid evidence.
meanings.sent4: The student whaled the debate competition, leaving everyone impressed.
meanings.sent5: The champion whaled all his challengers, proving his dominance.
